segments.title: Area Under Curve Significance
segments.summary: The area under the velocity curve represents the precise distance traveled by the car. This surprising connection shows how complex approximations can be simplified to just finding the area under a curve.

segments.title: Area As Problem-Solving Tool
segments.summary: Finding the area under a graph is presented as a common language for many different problems that involve summing large numbers of small things. It's described as a general problem-solving tool with broad applications.

segments.title: Negative Area Concept
segments.summary: Explains how negative areas under the curve are handled when the velocity is negative. Areas below the horizontal axis are counted as negative in integral calculations.

segments.title: Fundamental Theorem Application
segments.summary: Describes how the integral accounts for all points on a continuum between bounds, yet can be computed by only looking at two points through antiderivatives. This is presented as a remarkable feature of the fundamental theorem of calculus.

segments.title: Area Under Graph Visualization
segments.summary: Shows how to visualize the area under the velocity graph using rectangles as approximations. The smaller the time intervals, the better the approximation becomes.
